mods.abstract: Barber & Kluttz advertisement from The City of Knoxville and Vicinity and Their Resources. Published by the Knoxville Board of Trade. James T. Grady, Editor and Compiler. 1906. From p. [47]: Examples of work designed by Barber & Kluttz, Architects, Knoxville, Tenn. Chicago Office, W. 20th and S Streets. London Office, 34 Southampton Street, Strand, W.C. High-class service in buildings of every description. Illustrations: Residence of Thos Kelly, Esq. Winnipeg, Manitoba, Canada. Government Contractor.; Residence of Mr. C.M. McClung, Knoxville, Tennessee. Wholesale Dry Goods.; Residence of J.F. Keith, Esq. Beaumont, Texas. Original owner, Oil Lands. Submitted ID: The McClung house in this advertisement was located at 1625 Clinch Ave. It was not the home of C.M. McClung since Calvin M. McClung was still living in his house on Locust St. at least until 1913. This house was home to his cousin Thompson A. McClung.
